intro: Ardisia pichinchana, commonly known as the Pichincha ardisia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and evergreen trees. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. Ardisia pichinchana is often found in moist, shaded forest environments at higher elevations.
